Text.Value: True enough. I couldn't resist her charming company.
C'mon! Gotta let the drow know where them looters is. We'll be heroes!

EditorData.NodeContext: To player. More bright and friendly.

Text.Value: I just hate seeing animals in cages.
Quiet type, eh? Good. Keep outta trouble, or you and Saz'll get it.

EditorData.NodeContext: e's not exactly friendly here, but he will let you into camp.

Text.Value: That's enough outta you.

EditorData.NodeContext: Sazza to Olak. 'Shut up and let us in.'

Text.Value: Yes - I don't believe in keeping prisoners.
Go on. I ain't gonna hold up a drow.

EditorData.NodeContext: To player. Cool and malicious.
EditorData.logicalname: Player has access, a True Soul

Text.Value: Just hoping she'll prove useful.
Can it! I know something Ragzlin will want to hear.

EditorData.NodeContext: Sazza is ragging on Olak. They don't like each other.

Text.Value: My reasons are of no concern to you.
She'll be happy enough when I tell her where them looters is holin' up. Let me through.

EditorData.NodeContext: Hard 'g' on ranga. Sazza's pride is wounded but she hates Olak, so doesn't want to show it.

Text.Value: Behave yourself. Saz's vouchin' for you. You mess up, you and Saz'll get it.

EditorData.NodeContext: e's not exactly friendly here, but he will let you into camp.

Text.Value: I ain't gonna hold up a True Soul.

EditorData.NodeContext: To player. Cool and malicious.
EditorData.logicalname: Player has access, a True Soul

Text.Value: Well! Look what the rat dragged in.
Well! Look who's gettin' dragged back. And by such high company! How badly did you mess up?

EditorData.NodeContext: Olak to Sazza, a fellow goblin he doesn't have respect for.

Text.Value: Shrug and say nothing.
I been in some druids' grove. This one sprang me. Now move over, so I can tell Ragzlin myself!

EditorData.NodeContext: Sazza is arguing on the player's behalf to the hostile Olak.

Text.Value: It was a daring escape. Slew thirteen druids bare-handed, Sazza and I.
Err... Yeah, that's right!
C'mon! Gotta let the drow True Soul know where them looters is. We'll be heroes!

EditorData.NodeContext: To player. More bright and friendly.

Text.Value: I enjoy making new friends.
Ragzlin's other drow friend won't be happy to hear that.
Ragzlin's drow friend won't be happy to hear that.

EditorData.NodeContext: Full of mockery

Text.Value: Yeah? What's that?

EditorData.NodeContext: Malicious.

Text.Value: Hold on. Where are the raiders?

EditorData.NodeContext: Olak is full of gleeful malice.

Text.Value: C'mon! Gotta let the drow know where them looters is. We'll be heroes!

EditorData.NodeContext: To player. More bright and friendly.

Text.Value: Heh. Then behave while you're inside. Our people don't mind it one bit.

EditorData.NodeContext: i.e. 'our people don't mind putting people in cages'. He's not exactly friendly here, but he will let you into camp.

Text.Value: Go on ahead. Already met your little friend. Two of you can go celebrate together.

EditorData.NodeContext: To player. Cool and malicious.
EditorData.logicalname: Player has access, not a True Soul

Text.Value: Dead. Every last one.
Is it true, what Saz says? You helped her escape that grove?

EditorData.NodeContext: To player. Genuine inquiry, but he's disinclined to believe you.

Text.Value: Hah! A ranga and Sazza killing druids? Pull the other one.
Hold on, now.

EditorData.NodeContext: To player. Cool and malicious.

Text.Value: C'mon! Gotta let the drow know where them looters is. We'll be heroes!

EditorData.NodeContext: To player. More bright and friendly.

Text.Value: How'd a rat like you get in with a True Soul?

EditorData.NodeContext: Olak to Sazza, a fellow goblin he doesn't have respect for.

Text.Value: I'm only keeping her around in case I get hungry.

Synopsis:
If the player released the captured goblin in Halsin's den, the CG will be waiting for the player at the checkpoint. When the player starts the dialog with the main guard at the checkpoint (or gets closer to him) and the CG is at the checkpoint, this dialog is shown. After this dialog, the CG leaves the checkpoint and the main guard gets his normal dialog back.

 Olak and Sazza have a very antagonistic relationship, ripping each other to shreds.
